Description: Limestone stela of Qeh: this round-topped stela bears a scene in sunk relief with incised texts. The workman Qeh, standing on the left, is making an offering before the deified Amenhotep I who stands on the right. The top right corner of this stela is broken away and the edges are chipped in places. There are no traces of colour.
Curator's comments: The workman Qeh might be identified with the future chief workman Qeh, although other workmen of this name are known. Bibliography: G. Maspero, ‘Recueil de Travaux relatifs à la philology et à ‘archéologie égyptiennes et assyriennes 2 (Paris, 1880) 192-3; The British Museum, 'A guide to the Egyptian galleries (Sculpture)' (London, 1909), 104 (no. 358); B. Porter & R. Moss, 'Topographical Bibliography of Ancient Egyptian Hieroglyphic Texts, Reliefs and Paintings' I (Part 2) (Oxford: Clarendon Press), ii. 722-3; The British Museum, 'Hieroglyphic texts from Egyptian stelae, etc., in the British Museum' Part 6 (London, 1922), pl. 41.
Bibliographic references: Bierbrier 1982 / Hieroglyphic texts from Egyptian stelae, etc., in the British Museum, Part 10. (pl.66-67)
Associated names: Named in inscription & portrayed: Amenhotep I
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Somerset Lowry-Corry, 2nd Earl of Belmore
